articles.title: Repair cafe in Redcliffe joins international push for consumers' right to repair - ABC News
articles.description: A community project to fix items that would otherwise be thrown into landfill has had major success. It comes as the Productivity Commission releases a report pushing for Australian consumer law changes.
articles.content:

articles.title: As critics slam vaccine-hoarding countries, Australia has the world's largest reserved supply - 9News
articles.description: After struggling for months to get its hands on shots, Australia has risen to the top of the global leaderboard for vaccine supply, on a per capita basis.

articles.title: Australia joins US and others in concern over reports of extra-judicial killings in Afghanistan - 9News
articles.description: Report alleged more than a hundred former Afghan security forces had been killed or forcibly disappeared by the Taliban since their surrender in late summer.

articles.description: Businesses in Ballarat are bracing for an influx of protesters on Sunday rallying against the Andrews Government’s controversial new pandemic powers and sweeping vaccine mandates.

articles.title: Labor pledges free TAFE and more university places - 9News
articles.description: Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese has proposed a $1.2 billion 'Future Made in Australia Skills Plan' to address skills shortages through new places at university and TAFE.

articles.title: Total solar eclipse seen from Union Glacier, Antarctica - Africanews English
articles.description:
A total solar eclipse could be seen from Antarctica on Saturday with NASA live streaming the event, showing a striking image of the sky darkening.
Those living in southern parts of Africa, Australia and South America could also witness a partial solar eclipse.
